description.narrative: (West Bank and Gaza): The School Support Program (SSP) focuses on enhancing the quality of education in marginalized schools in the West Bank through a holistic approach that includes training, enhancing school infrastructure, providing equipment and supplies, and increasing parent and community engagement in school activities. FY 2015 funds will continue to target 50 economically and educationally marginalized schools in the West Bank. SSP partially supports Goal # 3 of the Agency Education Strategy by catering to educational systems in conflict areas and rehabilitation of education facilities, ensuring a safe and conducive learning environment for all. An exemption from implementing the Strategy was received for other components such as teacher training, counselling and extracurricular activities. SSP aims at improving students learning outcomes and potentially decreasing rates of school dropouts and violence among students.Over the life of the project, the SSP will target 50 schools, benefitting more than 17,000 vulnerable students. This program contributes to the Basic Education earmark.
